summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Taylor Avenue, from Mercer Street to East Queen Anne Drive; East Queen Anne Drive, from Taylor Avenue to Fifth Avenue North; Fifth Avenue North, from Galer Street to East Queen Anne Drive and from East Queen Anne Drive to Lynn Street; Bigelow Avenue, from Howe Street to McGraw Street; Lynn Street, from Fifth Avenue North to Bigelow Avenue; McGraw Street, from Bigelow Avenue to Fourth Avenue North; Galer Street; from Fifth Avenue North to Sixth Avenue North; all in the City of Seattle, by constructing therein watermains of proper dimensions, together with all necessary crosses, tees, gates, fire hydrants and other appurtenances, in accordance with Resolution No. 8 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899.
